sub_topic: The chaotic behavior of the Mackey-Glass equation
message_1: What is the largest Lyapunov exponent for the Mackey-Glass system with delay parameter α=0.2, feedback gain β=0.1, time delay τ=17, and initial condition x(0)=1?

dx(t)/dt = α * x(t - τ) / (1 + x(t - τ)^β) - x(t)

where α is the delay parameter, β is the feedback gain, and τ is the time delay. In this case, α=0.2, β=0.1, and τ=17.
